details.notes:
Senior Sanctionary officer of the Oath Guard on Desoleum.

Dispassionate: All skill tests to socially interact with this Sanctionary suffer a −20 penalty.

Rank-and-file Sanctionary of the Desoleum Oath Guard.

Look the Other Way: Characters who offer a suitable bribe gain a +10 bonus to Interaction skill tests involving this Sanctionary.

Undercover operative disguised as a hive dreg.

Layers Within Layers: Any Acolyte may make a Very Hard (−30) Scrutiny test to realise the dreg is an active undercover operative.

Leader of the Red Walk gang. A brutal and charismatic gang boss who rules through fear and spectacle.

Battlefield Coordination: Once per round as a Half Action, make an Ordinary (+10) Command test. On success, up to 3 allies can make an out-of-turn Move action.

Officer of the Red Walk gang, a vicious melee fighter who performs for the boss.

Perform for the Boss: Gains +20 to Strength, Toughness, and Agility tests if the Gang Leader is observing.

Street-level Red Walk gang member, relying on numbers and aggression.

Courage in Numbers: +5 WS per ally beyond the first within 5m. −10 WP if no allies within 5m.

Massive brute of the Red Walk gang, wielding an enormous blade.

Artists of the Arena: While a lieutenant, leader, or audience watches, inflicts +2 damage on attacks.

Legendary waste-nomad driver and guide, viewed as a holy madman by the Desoleum nomads.

Favoured of the Gods: Waste nomads view Travers as a holy madman. Social tests with nomads gain +20 in his presence (not vs Frohrn).

Shrewd waste-nomad trader who can procure almost anything for the right price.

Everything for Everyone: A successful Commerce test grants +20 (instead of the usual +10) on Requisition tests.

A massive burrowing predator of the Desoleum wastes. Ambushes prey from beneath the sand.

Ambush Hunter: +4 damage against Unaware targets.

Chieftain of the Gwydrae waste-nomads. A legendary warrior and leader feared across the Desoleum wastes.

Lead by Example: When Frohrn succeeds on an attack, allies within 10m gain +10 WS/BS until his next turn.

Elite warrior of the Gwydrae nomad tribe, fiercely loyal to their chieftain.

Failure is Death: Once per turn in sight of chieftain, suffer 1 Fatigue to re-roll a failed WS test.

Spiritual leader of the Gwydrae nomads, communing with the spirits of their ancestors.

Communing with the Ancients: Once per encounter, spend a Full Action to use the Inferno psychic power as if cast with Psy Rating 5.

Rank-and-file warrior of the Gwydrae nomad tribe.

Resilience of the Desert: Once per encounter, as a Full Action, make a Challenging (+0) Toughness test to remove 1 point of damage.

Missionary preacher who has wandered the Desoleum wastes for decades, ministering to the nomads.

Fiery Oratory: Once per encounter, as a Full Action, make an Ordinary (+10) Charm test. On success, allies within 10m gain Hatred (Heretics) for the encounter.

Ambitious and cunning leader of the Adherent Trade Sable, a powerful smuggling cartel.

A Step Too Far: Acolytes gain +10 to Opposed social tests vs Hresk. On failure, Disposition drops by −10 and Hresk shifts to Aggressive.

Hresk's right-hand man and trusted lieutenant within the Trade Sable.

The Power Behind the Throne: Disposition +10 and Personality becomes Confident if Hresk dies.

Smuggler in the employ of the Adherent Trade Sable cartel.

Courage in Numbers: While a trusted ally is within 5m, gains Jaded and Iron Jaw.

Fanatical follower of the Children of the Inheritance cult.

Martyrs to the Cause: When reduced to 0 wounds, makes one Standard Attack at the closest enemy at −20. Then dies.

Adeptus Mechanicus Tech-Priest with extensive augmetics and deep technical knowledge.

Expert Aid: Grants a +30 bonus when Assisting on Tech-Use tests.

Rogue Trader of ancient lineage, commanding a powerful voidship and a web of favours across the sector.

Web of Favours and Oaths: While aboard his vessel and in his good graces, Acolytes may use his Influence (41) for Influence tests. On failure, he demands a favour.

Anzaforr's fiercely loyal bodyguard and first mate.

Service Unto Death: If an enemy attacks the Rogue Trader and Hessiial is within 3m, he may use his Reaction to Parry the attack. Hits apply to Hessiial instead.

Eldar Ranger, a deadly xenos marksman of inhuman precision and stealth.

Living Ghost: Scores two extra degrees of success on successful Stealth tests.

Shady merchant and drug dealer operating aboard the Rogue Trader's vessel.

A Nose for Business: Addictive drugs are one Availability level easier when purchased through Cincayde.

Aged and frail Imperial preacher, dedicated to the God-Emperor despite his declining health.

Life's Twilight: Whenever suffering Fatigue, suffers double the number of Fatigue levels.

Firebrand Confessor of the Imperial Creed, driven by zealous fervour.

The Fires of Faith: When swaying groups into fervour, make a Subtlety test. On failure, gains a bonus equal to 10 × Degrees of Failure. If heretical cults are revealed, gains Halo of Command and +20 to Social tests.

Leader of the Children of the Inheritance cult. A powerful psyker shielded by the minds of his followers.

Fortress of Deranged Minds: When defending vs a psychic power, gains +10 per other Inheritor within 5m.

Psychic Powers: Assail, Enfeeble, Gate of Infinity, Life Leech.

Higher-ranking cultist of the Children of the Inheritance, leading the Proselytes.

Directed Action: If other Inheritors are within 10m, gains +10 to WS and BS tests.

Powerful lord of the shrine world of Thaur, wielding great political and spiritual authority.

Censer of Mourning: +20 to Social tests with loyal Thaur natives. Contains Best quality conversion field.

Officer of the Mournful Guard, Thaur's elite law enforcement and honour guard.

Commanding Presence: Once per encounter, re-roll a failed Command or Intimidate test.

Rank-and-file soldier of Thaur's Mournful Guard.

Knowledge of the Beat: In pursuit of lawful duty, re-roll one failed Awareness or Investigate test per encounter.

Guardian of the ossuaries of Thaur, protecting the sacred bone-relics of the dead.

Righteous Blaze: Once per encounter after dealing damage, deal additional 1d10+5 E damage ignoring armour. The weapon loses the Flame quality until repaired (1 day).

Powerful Imperial psyker and servant of the Inquisition, wielding devastating pyromantic powers.

Arsenal of Fate: Can gain an extra Half Action for a Focus Power test. Roll 1d10 + Degrees of Failure; on 9+ one xenos artefact is destroyed.

Psychic Powers: Crush, Flame Breath, Fire Shield, Foreboding, Spontaneous Combustion.

A terrifying Daemon Prince, a being of immense warp power that threatens to consume all in its path.

Prince of the Immaterium: Characters within 15m who fail a Willpower test suffer 1 Corruption.

Flood of Unreality: Gains an extra Half Action each turn for flying or psychic powers.

Dark Reclamation: Spend a Half Action to reclaim a corrupted artefact, destroying it but healing 1d10 damage.

Psychic Powers: Assail, Haemorrhage, Molten Beam, Puppet Master, Smite, Telekine Shield, Warp Speed.
